definition: army of Zhao 趙國|赵国 during the Warring States
to surpass (old)
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
(bound form) army/military

sentences.english: Following the briefing, Zhao Jun and Cui Tiankai took questions from the journalists.
sentences.chinese: 介绍情况后，赵军和崔天凯回答了记者的提问。

sentences.english: Zhao made me feel a links also praised the spirit up.
sentences.chinese: 赵军的一通吹捧让我觉得自己也精神起来。

sentences.english: As a result, they were surrounded by the army of Qin till the supplies were exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 结果，赵军被秦军包围，直至弹尽粮绝。

sentences.english: Do you remember the location of Zhao camp?
sentences.chinese: 可还记得赵军驻扎的地点？

definition: the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
Zhao Kuo (-260 BC), hapless general of Zhao 趙國|赵国, who famously led an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC/also called Ma Fuzi 馬服子|马服子
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
battle of Changping of 260 BC, at which the Qin army 秦軍|秦军[Qin2 jun1] encircled and annihilated a Zhao army of 400,000
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Qin general Meng Tian (-210 BC), involved in 215 BC in fighting the Northern Xiongnu 匈奴 and building the great wall
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Li Ling (-74 BC), Han dynasty general whose defeat by the Xiongnu 匈奴 in 104 BC led to a major scandal
Li Guang (-119 BC), Han dynasty general, nicknamed Flying General 飛將軍|飞将军 and much feared by the Xiongnu 匈奴
Xiang Yu the Conqueror (232-202 BC), warlord defeated by first Han emperor
Vertical Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
ancient place name, in Anhui province
Lian Po (327-243 BC), famous general of Zhao 趙國|赵国, repeatedly victorious over Qin 秦國|秦国 and Qi 齊國|齐国
enemy troops/hostile forces/CL:股[gu3]
Wang Ping (1962-2013), PRC crosstalk actor
